en: "Looks like Maki's a twin!" Ken said. "Really now," I replied, totally uninterested. Maki was a member of a ukulele club that ran beside our club in the school lounge. She looked lovely in Ken's eyes, but to me she was just the sixth cutest girl in class - average, in my opinion.
zh: “看来真希有个双胞胎啊！”健说。“是吗，”我毫无兴趣地回了一句。真希是尤克里里社团的，他们的活动室就在学校休息室我们社团旁边。在健眼里她很可爱，但在我看来，她也就班里第六漂亮——反正我觉得挺一般的。

en: "Do you know what kind of tree you just broke?" "No, I don't," I answered the detective. While looking through the open door, the detective shouted, "Hey, do you know what kind of tree he just broke?" "Um, looks like it's a yew plum pine," said the voice of a young woman. After straightening himself in his seat, the detective asked me one more time: "Do you know what kind of tree you just broke?"
zh: “你知道你刚才弄断的是什么树吗？”“不知道，”我回答警探。警探一边透过开着的门往外看，一边喊道：“嘿，你知道他刚才弄断的是什么树吗？”“嗯，好像是罗汉松，”一个年轻女人的声音响起。警探坐直了身子，又问了我一遍：“你知道你刚才弄断的是什么树吗？”

en: The store that I always go to has Calbee potato chips on sale for 98 yen a bag. My favorite flavor is lightly salted. As a matter of fact, the ingredients for this particular flavor changes from time to time. Today's chips are chemical-free, made with natural salt. Fitting for someone like me.

en: I've kept a blog before. I didn't really have a set theme; I just blogged about whatever happened that day.

en: If you calmly look at the reply you sent to an email, you'll find that it'll have "you" all over it. While you may use the pretext that you're just working with whatever information the addressee gave you, in the end it's just all about yourself. This is wrong. Let's be a little more careful, shall we?
zh: 如果你冷静地看看你发的邮件回复，你会发现里面全是“你”字。虽然你可能辩称只是在处理对方提供的信息，但归根结底还是为了你自己。这样不对。我们还是再细心点吧，好吗？

en: You say that you're afraid of being disliked by other people, but you have some people that you dislike yourself, don't you? Arithmetically speaking, there are an equal number of people who you don't like that don't like you back. I'm not saying that if you end your dislike of someone, someone else will stop disliking you as well; it's just that you can't change the fact that if you dislike someone, then someone else dislikes you as well. Your life will go much smoother if you just give up and accept that truth.
zh: 你说你怕被别人讨厌，但你自己也有讨厌的人，不是吗？从数学上讲，你不喜欢的人和不喜欢你的人数量是一样的。我不是说如果你不再讨厌某人，别人也会停止讨厌你；只是你无法改变这样一个事实：如果你讨厌某人，那么也有人讨厌你。如果你认命并接受这个事实，你的生活会顺畅得多。

en: No, Dad!
zh: 不要，爸！

en: Mother is cooking in the kitchen.
zh: 妈在厨房做饭。

en: God doesn't exist.
zh: 上帝是不存在的。

en: Dick got in a traffic accident.
zh: 迪克出车祸了。

en: Dick was in a traffic accident.
zh: 迪克遭遇了车祸。

en: Dick was involved in a traffic accident.
zh: 迪克卷入了一场交通事故。

en: Please send me a letter as soon as you arrive.
zh: 你一到就给我寄封信吧。

en: You are a panda.
zh: 你是个熊猫。

en: It feels like translating has not become very enjoyable.
zh: 感觉翻译变得没什么意思了。

en: I feel like translating has become very unenjoyable.
zh: 我觉得翻译已经变得很无趣了。

en: I feel like somehow I've stopped thinking of translation as something enjoyable.
zh: 我觉得不知怎么的，我已经不再把翻译当成一件乐事了。

en: You shouldn't complain because you'll look ugly.
zh: 别抱怨了，抱怨的样子很难看。

en: Suzanne is the girl over there speaking with Jan.
zh: 苏珊就是那边那个正在跟简说话的女孩。

en: I think I'll have more fun reading something now. I was always part of the bookworm group, but there are times when I just don't feel like reading anything. Right now I'm getting lots of "Read! Read!" waves coming at me.
zh: 我觉得我现在看书会挺有意思的。我以前一直是个书虫，但也有什么都不想读的时候。现在我感觉脑子里全是“读吧！读吧！”这种念头。

en: Eat anything you like.
zh: 想吃什么就吃什么。

en: I wholeheartedly admire your understanding of Chinese.
zh: 我由衷地钦佩你对中文的理解。

en: What a beautiful night!
zh: 多美的夜晚啊！

en: Are you on your way to the tennis court?
zh: 你是在去网球场的路上吗？

en: Are you going to the tennis court?
zh: 你要去网球场吗？

en: Just stick to the protocol, would you?
zh: 按规矩办行吗？

en: I had a good sleep till ten.
zh: 我一觉睡到了十点。

en: Expedited delivery will cost an additional ten dollars.
zh: 加急配送要多收十块钱。

en: People believe what they see.
zh: 人们只相信自己看到的。

en: He and I are almost the same height.
zh: 他和我差不多高。

en: He has always got his head stuck in a book.
zh: 他整天钻在书堆里。

en: He's a historian. He's now studying the structure of war.
zh: 他是个历史学家，现在正在研究战争的结构。

en: Love is not just a feeling, but also an art.
zh: 爱不只是一种感觉，更是一门艺术。

en: I sometimes hear rumors about her.
zh: 我偶尔会听到一些关于她的传闻。

en: She is pretty rather than beautiful.
zh: 她与其说是美丽，不如说是好看。

en: Even now when I see a terakoya play, I feel somewhat nostalgic.
zh: 即使是现在，看到寺子屋的戏，我还是会感到有些怀旧。

en: This vitamin boosts your immune system from diseases.
zh: 这种维生素可以增强你抵抗疾病的免疫力。

en: It might be because I am near-sighted, but I can't read or write if my desk is not in a brightly lit place.
zh: 可能是因为我近视吧，如果桌子不在光线充足的地方，我就没法看书写字。

en: It has been a habit of mine for many years that when I am in my home, apart from mealtimes, I hardly ever leave my desk.
zh: 这么多年我都有个习惯，只要在家里，除了吃饭时间，我几乎不离开书桌。

en: You're a panda.
zh: 你是只熊猫。

en: Give me the slippers! Hey! Give them to me!
zh: 把拖鞋给我！喂！给我！

en: The clock struck half past 12.
zh: 钟敲了十二点半。

en: Master rang the bell.
zh: 主人摇了铃。

en: Only humans can laugh.
zh: 只有人类才会笑。

en: Even when you think about it in a very commonsensical way, a life without laughter is gloomy and cold. Furthermore, it is thought to be unhealthy.
zh: 即便是用常识去想，没有笑声的生活也是阴沉冷清的，而且还被认为是不健康的。

en: Why do humans laugh? That's quite a difficult problem.
zh: 人为什么要笑？这可真是个难题。

en: Why do humans smile? This is a very difficult question to answer.
zh: 人为什么要微笑？这是一个很难回答的问题。

en: This is a true story. A woman was admitted to a reputed obstetrics clinic to give birth.
zh: 这是一个真实的故事。一个女人去了一家很有名的产科诊所生孩子。

en: The prime minister will make an announcement tomorrow.
zh: 首相明天会发表公告。

en: Nobles do not exist merely because there is a peerage system. Even if there were no peerage system, there will be people who are naturally dominant and who will quickly rise to nobility. So much for our nobility then. Why, we are mere peasants.
zh: 贵族的存在不仅仅是因为有爵位制度。即便没有爵位制度，也会有天生卓越的人迅速跻身贵族阶层。至于我们的贵族身份嘛，其实我们只是平民。

en: It's not because you have a title, that you're a noble. There are people who have a natural nobility and are fine nobles. People like us who only have nobility titles are not nobles, we're more like peasants.
zh: 并不是有了头衔就是贵族。有些人天生高贵，是真正的贵族。像我们这种空有头衔的人根本不是贵族，我们更像是平民。

en: Sometimes I say "yes," even though I want to say "no."
zh: 有时候虽然我想说“不”，但还是说了“好”。

en: That student is very fast at running isn't he?
zh: 那个学生跑得真快，是吧？

en: He came home because he had run out of money, not because he was homesick.
zh: 他回家是因为没钱了，而不是因为想家。

en: Lucy approached the young man and put her hand on his head.
zh: 露西走到那个年轻人跟前，把手放在了他的头上。

en: Everyone likes big pizzas.
zh: 大家都喜欢大号披萨。

en: That's my CD, isn't it?
zh: 那是我的CD，对吧？

en: I hope that you are very well.
zh: 希望你一切都好。

en: He got married at 22.
zh: 他22岁就结婚了。

en: He got married when he was twenty-two years old.
zh: 他二十二岁的时候结婚了。

en: When I was in Paris, I became acquainted with two or three painters, and I went to visit their atelier from time to time. I was always fascinated by their method of work and their way of life.
zh: 我在巴黎的时候，结识了两三个画家，经常去他们的画室串门。我一直对他们的工作和生活方式很着迷。

en: I visited the atelier of a painter that I had not visited in a long time. This painter had just acquired a new model and he was in a very good mood.
zh: 我去拜访了一个很久没见的画家的画室。这个画家刚找了个新模特，心情特别好。

en: One time, I went to the atelier of a painter I had just met in the middle of the night. It was a dark room in an attic.
zh: 有一次，我在半夜去了一个刚认识的画家的画室。那是个在阁楼里的黑屋子。

en: Tens of male and female students were drawing a lone - completely nude - male model standing on a platform.
zh: 几十个男女学生正在画一个独自站在台子上的全裸男模特。

en: Dozens of male and female students were drawing a lone, completely nude male model standing on a platform.
zh: 几十名男女学生正在画一个独自站在台子上的、一丝不挂的男模特。

en: What kind of sweets did I like as a child? Even if I try to remember, I can't.
zh: 我小时候喜欢吃什么甜食？怎么想也想不起来了。

en: I can't remember which sweets I liked as a child.
zh: 我记不得小时候喜欢吃哪种甜食了。

en: When I was 17 or 18 years old, I started buying candy with my own money and I always bought marshmallows.
zh: 我十七八岁的时候，开始自己花钱买糖吃，那时候总买棉花糖。

en: Of the sweets that I tasted in France, the ones that I'd like to eat most are the brioche, the baba au rhum and the marrons glacés.
zh: 在法国吃过的甜点里，我最想吃的是布里欧修、朗姆酒巴巴和糖渍栗子。

en: The brioche is like the bastard child of sponge cake and bread, but its taste is peerless.
zh: 布里欧修就像是海绵蛋糕和面包的“私生子”，但那味道绝了。

en: The brioche is like the bastard child of sponge cake and bread, but its feeling under the tongue is the best under the heavens.
zh: 布里欧修就像是海绵蛋糕和面包的“私生子”，但那口感简直是人间极品。

en: A marron glacé is a sugar coated chestnut, similar to the Japanese sweet natto.
zh: 糖渍栗子就是裹了糖浆的栗子，跟日本的甘纳豆差不多。

en: By the way, the pastry known as "Shu Cream" in Japan is not known under this name neither in England nor in France. If you ask for a "Shu Cream" in England, you will end up comically receiving shoe shine.
zh: 顺便说一下，在日本叫“泡芙（Shu Cream）”的那种点心，在英国和法国都不叫这个。如果你在英国要个“Shu Cream”，最后可能会闹笑话，拿到擦鞋油。

en: Recently my brother in law, artillery major Y, came back from a three year trip in Paris. Surrounded by a great number of souvenirs he had brought back, we heard tales of his travels.
zh: 最近我姐夫，炮兵少校Y，结束了为期三年的巴黎之行回来了。我们围在他带回来的那一大堆纪念品旁，听他讲旅行见闻。

en: I feel somewhat uneasy when I sit on a chair with Japanese clothes. I feel like the wind is blowing in from the cuff of my trousers.
zh: 穿和服坐椅子总觉得有点不自在，感觉冷风直往裤脚里钻。

en: When it comes to cheese, it's Camembert. More than the taste, it makes me nostalgic.
zh: 说到奶酪，那还得是卡门贝尔。比起味道，它更让我感到怀念。

en: The architecture... I don't really care about it. I just want a comfortable study and comfortable bedroom.
zh: 建筑什么的……我倒不太在乎。我只想要个舒服的书房和卧室。

en: Friendship in itself is something very vague and even in cases of same-sex friendships, it takes many shapes and is brought on by many different motives.
zh: 友情本身就是个很模糊的东西，哪怕是同性之间的友谊，也有各种形式，动机也各不相同。

en: As a rule, not only in humans, but also in animals, "sexual display" occurs, consciously or unconsciously, towards individuals of the opposite sex.
zh: 通常情况下，不只是人类，动物也会自觉或不自觉地对异性表现出“求偶行为”。

en: Suppressing one's romantic feelings is not the same as having no such feelings.
zh: 压抑自己的感情并不代表没有这种感情。

en: This author doesn't understand at all what need would a man and a woman who can't be involved in a romantic relationship have of becoming friends.
zh: 这位作者完全不明白，那些没法谈恋爱的男女为什么非得做朋友。

en: This author doesn't understand at all why a man and a woman who can't become lovers would become friends.
zh: 这位作者根本理解不了，既然成不了恋人，男女之间为什么还要做朋友。

en: He's a modern boy.
zh: 他是个摩登男孩。

en: She's a modern girl.
zh: 她是个摩登女孩。

en: I liked walking alone on the deserted beach in the evening.
zh: 我喜欢傍晚独自在空旷的海滩上散步。

en: Everytime her husband looked at me, he almost asked me: "For what purpose have you come here?"
zh: 每次她丈夫盯着我，都像是要问：“你来这儿到底是干什么的？”

en: On a certain monday afternoon, a single horse carriage stopped in front of the hotel where I was staying.
zh: 某个周一的下午，一辆单马马车停在了我住的旅馆门前。

en: The person who descended from the coach was a woman of about 22 or 23 with, if I had to say, a plain appearance. At a glance, I knew that she was a guest coming from Paris. She was alone.
zh: 下车的是个二十二三岁的女人，长相怎么说呢，挺普通的。我一眼就看出她是刚从巴黎过来的游客。她是一个人。

en: I asked her for her address.
zh: 我向她要了地址。

en: Three days passed, four days passed. The wind blew once, it rained twice.
zh: 三天过去了，四天过去了。刮了一次风，下了两场雨。

en: As was my habit, I was walking on the beach after the rain.
zh: 我像往常一样，雨后在海滩上散步。

en: Right feels wrong and wrong feels right.
zh: 对的觉得不对，错的反而觉得对了。

en: As was unusual for me, I got tired quickly and I sat down on the edge of a rock.
zh: 反常的是，我很快就累了，就在一块岩石边坐了下来。

en: Suddenly, I raised my ears to the faint sound of footsteps coming from behind me.
zh: 突然，我听到身后传来隐约的脚步声，不禁竖起了耳朵。

en: That was her. She was trying to creep up on me unnoticed.
zh: 是她。她想悄悄走近我，不被我察觉。

en: That was her. She was trying to sneak up on me silently.
zh: 是她。她正试图悄无声息地向我靠近。

en: Her husband was supposed to come visit her from Paris for a single night Saturday night.
zh: 她丈夫本该周六晚上从巴黎过来陪她住一个晚上。

en: In Paris and elsewhere, in the summer, husbands send their wives and children somewhere to escape the heat and they customarily leave to visit them on Saturday evening until Sunday.
zh: 在巴黎或其他地方，夏天的时候，丈夫们会把妻儿送到避暑地，而他们通常周六晚上过去看他们，一直待到周日。

en: Her body was already in the water from the waist down.
zh: 她的下半身已经没入了水中。

en: Soon, I could only see her neck floating above the waves.
zh: 很快，我只能看到她在浪花中露出的脖子了。

en: I had not once thought about going into the sea since I came here, but at this moment, for some reason, I wanted to remove my clothes.
zh: 来到这儿后我还没想过要下海，但那一刻，不知为什么，我竟然想脱掉衣服。

en: She rarely talked to anybody.
zh: 她几乎不跟任何人说话。

en: "Novels? I hate novels." Oh muse, forgive her blasphemy.
zh: “小说？我最讨厌小说了。”噢，缪斯啊，请原谅她的亵渎。

en: I heard a voice saying "Help me!". I laughed.
zh: 我听到有个声音在喊“救救我！”，我笑了。

en: I heard a voice cry "Help!". I was laughing.
zh: 我听到有人大喊“救命！”，我当时正在笑。

en: I unconsciously removed my shirt.
zh: 我下意识地脱掉了衬衫。

en: I jumped into the water as in a trance.
zh: 我恍恍惚惚地跳进了水里。

en: At last, I brought her exhausted body upon the beach.
zh: 终于，我把精疲力竭的她带到了岸上。

en: The next day, at suppertime, I was introduced to her husband.
zh: 第二天吃晚饭的时候，我被介绍给了她丈夫。

en: For some reason, her husband seemed to dislike that she spoke of me. In truth, she talked too much about me.
zh: 不知道为什么，她丈夫好像不喜欢她提起我。事实上，她确实说得太多了。

en: The following morning she said close to my ears: "We're going back to Paris tonight. He says that there's no way that he'll leave me alone in such a sad place. That's how it is."
zh: 第二天早上，她贴着我的耳朵说：“我们今晚回巴黎。他说绝对不能把我一个人丢在这么凄凉的地方。事情就是这样。”

en: The couple took a horse carriage that evening.
zh: 那天傍晚，那对夫妻坐马车走了。

en: I liked walking alone on the deserted beach.
zh: 我喜欢独自在空旷的海滩上散步。

en: It's outrageous that you're riding a bicycle even though you're a woman. Women should stop trying to imitate men.
zh: 你一个女人竟然还骑自行车，真是成何体统。女人不该总想着模仿男人。

en: Three soldiers who came back from the war are renting a house at the edge of a small town on the shore of the Inland Sea and live together.
zh: 三个刚从战场回来的士兵，在内海边的一个小镇郊区租了间房子住在一起。

en: The three veterans lived together in a rented cottage on the outskirts of a small town on the edge of the inland sea.
zh: 那三个老兵在内海边的小镇郊外租了间小屋住在一起。

en: When I play peekaboo with my baby, he stops crying immediately.
zh: 每次我跟宝宝玩躲猫猫，他就立刻不哭了。

en: Jim put the key into the lock.
zh: 吉姆把钥匙插进了锁孔。

en: I don't like beer that much.
zh: 我不太喜欢喝啤酒。

en: In the end, "feminity" is something that a woman is naturally furnished with, there is no need to make any effort to show it, and it's a quality such that even if one were to make conscious efforts to hide it, it would lead to nothing.
zh: 说到底，“女人味”是女人天生自带的，没必要刻意表现，而且这种东西就算你想藏也藏不住。

en: Old customs are gradually being destroyed.
zh: 旧习俗正逐渐被废除。

en: I saw some English female soldiers in yesterday night's news reel. For some, you couldn't tell whether it was a man or a woman, but the majority were rather feminine, and it didn't feel that grotesque.
zh: 我在昨晚的新闻短片里看到了一些英国女兵。有的根本分不清男女，但大多数还是挺有女人味的，并不觉得奇怪。

en: Please forgive my impoliteness in sending you suddenly such a strange letter.
zh: 冒昧给您写这么一封奇怪的信，请原谅。

en: She, with such a sweet and pure figure, killed herself while cursing both of our names.
zh: 长相那么甜美纯洁的她，竟然一边咒骂着我们两个人的名字一边自杀了。

en: Yuriko Himekusa committed suicide.
zh: 姬草百合子自杀了。

en: Yuriko Himekusa killed herself.
zh: 姬草百合子寻了短见。

en: All of a sudden, the front door bell rang and the dark shadow of a lone man slipped in quietly.
zh: 突然，门铃响了，一个男人的黑影悄悄溜了进来。

en: This year is two thousand eleven.
zh: 今年是二零一一年。

en: I have fifteen hundred cows.
zh: 我有一千五百头牛。

en: I have one thousand and five hundred cows.
zh: 我有一千五百头牛。

en: We live near the large library.
zh: 我们住在那座大图书馆附近。

en: Was there an autopsy?
zh: 尸检了吗？

en: Is it OK to smoke around here?
zh: 这儿能抽烟吗？

en: It has been getting colder and colder, and I spend much more time in my futon.
zh: 天越来越冷了，我待在被窝里的时间也越来越长。

en: I will email you after I check it thoroughly.
zh: 我仔细检查过后再给你发邮件。

en: I do a lot in parallel, therefore I do not only read Akutagawa. At the moment, I am reading more and more in English. I am also reading a bit in German every day.
zh: 我同时在做很多事，所以不只是在看芥川的书。最近我读英文书的时间越来越多，每天还会读点德文。

en: I do many things at the same time, so not only am I reading things by Akutagawa, I've also increased the amount of time I spend reading in English and I also read a little in German every day.
zh: 我好几件事同时进行，所以除了读芥川的作品，我也增加了读英文的时间，每天还会读点德语。

en: Have you finished reading the biography of Jobs?
zh: 乔布斯的传记你看完了吗？

en: Have you finished reading the book of Jobs?
zh: 乔布斯那本书你看完了吗？

en: You chicken out again, you coward?
zh: 你又怂了，你这个胆小鬼？

en: My mom is two years younger than my dad.
zh: 我妈比我爸小两岁。

en: The only thing that I know for certain is that I exist.
zh: 我唯一能肯定的就是我存在。

en: Have you forgotten about me?
zh: 你把我忘了吗？

en: He was killed by my hand.
zh: 他死在了我手里。

en: The Titanic's maiden voyage didn't go so well.
zh: 泰坦尼克号的首航不太顺利。

en: The night before we were to be married, she had an affair with my best friend.
zh: 就在我们要结婚的前一晚，她和我最好的朋友好上了。

en: It's a very bizarre animal.
zh: 那是一种非常古怪的动物。

en: Do you have a best friend?
zh: 你有最好的朋友吗？

en: There was some dew this morning.
zh: 今天早上有露水。

en: The price of my dress' fabric is 10 Euros per meter.
zh: 我这件裙子的布料是十欧元一米。

en: Our school is further away than the station.
zh: 我们学校比车站还远。

en: Her shyness makes me like her even more.
zh: 她害羞的样子让我更喜欢她了。

en: What's the commotion?
zh: 吵什么呢？

en: The weather report said that there will be thunderstorms tomorrow evening.
zh: 天气预报说明晚会有雷阵雨。

en: That's not it.
zh: 不是那样的。

en: You shouldn't keep towels and cleaning rags together.
zh: 你不该把毛巾和抹布放在一起。

en: He's in the kitchen.
zh: 他在厨房。

en: It's time for us to leave.
zh: 我们该走了。

en: I'm used to staying awake late into the night.
zh: 我习惯熬夜了。

en: Cats don't eat bananas.
zh: 猫不吃香蕉。

en: Healing the wounds of the heart takes time.
zh: 心灵的创伤需要时间来愈合。

en: I can see a woman and two dogs in the car.
zh: 我看见车里有一个女人和两只狗。

en: They must've had an accident.
zh: 他们肯定出事了。

en: Tom ate a crocodile.
zh: 汤姆吃过鳄鱼。

en: He was innocent.
zh: 他是无辜的。

en: Dinner was awesome.
zh: 晚饭太棒了。

en: Emails have started suddenly disappearing from my inbox.
zh: 收件箱里的邮件突然开始消失了。

en: I subscribed to a new email magazine.
zh: 我订阅了一份新的电子杂志。

en: I want to go to the moon.
zh: 我想去月球。

en: I received an eReader for Christmas.
zh: 圣诞节我收到了一台电子阅读器。

en: Do you have a ticket?
zh: 你有票吗？

en: Do you have the tickets?
zh: 票都在你那儿吗？

en: I'll show you around town.
zh: 我带你在城里逛逛。

en: When I take a deep breath, a pain runs down the right side of my back.
zh: 我深呼吸的时候，后背右侧会疼。

en: Chances are here, take them.
zh: 机会就在这儿，抓住它。

en: In a few seconds I would have overcome the desperation threshold.
zh: 再过几秒钟，我就能撑过绝望的极限了。

en: Do Martians speak English?
zh: 火星人说英语吗？

en: I've got a feeling that something is about to happen.
zh: 我预感到要发生什么事了。

en: I've got a feeling that Tom won't graduate this year.
zh: 我觉得汤姆今年毕业不了。

en: I pawned my guitar to pay the rent.
zh: 我把吉他当了来付房租。

en: Put down your weapons!
zh: 放下武器！

en: It's a great plan, innit.
zh: 这计划挺棒的，对吧？

en: I want to become a bisque doll maker.
zh: 我想当个陶瓷娃娃制作师。

en: Janet Jackson had a wardrobe malfunction.
zh: 珍妮·杰克逊在表演时走光了。

en: What is the time?
zh: 几点了？

en: I couldn't answer.
zh: 我答不上来。

en: "You should write a novel or something." "Nah, I don't think so. I can't see myself coming up with anything good, anyways."
zh: “你应该写本小说什么的。”“得了吧，我觉得不行。反正我也写不出什么好东西。”

en: His book is oriented towards children, but here and there are words that he has never seen before. He doesn't know whether it is just him, or if they are just simply difficult words, but he finds them not worth the effort to look up in a dictionary, so he just keeps on reading.
zh: 他的书是给小孩子看的，但到处都是他没见过的词。他不知道是他的问题，还是那些词确实太难，但他觉得不值得去查字典，所以就这么一直读下去了。

en: My friend from university gave me a Kindle because he said he wasn't using it anymore. It's the DX model with a large screen. It's not easy to use, but the screen is indeed quite nice. It hadn't bothered me until now, but it's become hard for me to read something on a normal LCD screen.
zh: 我大学同学送了我一个Kindle，因为他说他不用了。是那个大屏的DX款。虽然不太好用，但屏幕确实挺舒服的。以前还没觉得，现在看普通的液晶屏都觉得累眼了。

en: You must not be a virgin, right?
zh: 你肯定不是处了吧？

en: You're not an innocent girl, are you?
zh: 你也不是什么纯情少女了吧？

en: I'm a human being.
zh: 我是个人。

en: His father is an impostor.
zh: 他父亲是个骗子。

en: Tom's constant arguing irritates some of his classmates. However, most of the class has just learned to ignore him.
zh: 汤姆老是跟人争个不停，这让一些同学挺反感的。不过班里大多数人已经习惯无视他了。

en: The economy is good.
zh: 经济挺好的。

en: I'm no liar.
zh: 我可没撒谎。

en: Cut me some slack.
zh: 饶了我吧。

en: Be careful!
zh: 小心！

en: Please put away this box for me.
zh: 帮我把这个箱子收起来。

en: Quit gambling.
zh: 别赌了。

en: It's like he has this special skill of hitting pressure points.
zh: 他好像特别擅长点穴。

en: If that's true, then she's better than me.
zh: 如果那是真的，那她比我强。

en: She overslept.
zh: 她睡过头了。

en: If you need an umbrella, I can lend you one.
zh: 如果你需要雨伞，我可以借你一把。

en: The girl hired by the shop to attract customers is quite cute and every time I go there I end up buying a lot of things.
zh: 店里那个招揽客人的妹子挺可爱的，我每次去最后都会买一大堆东西。

en: That's something that happens quite often.
zh: 这种事儿经常发生。

en: You can't trust computer translation.
zh: 电脑翻译不能全信。

en: How does that sound?
zh: 听起来怎么样？

en: We're on the way home.
zh: 我们在回家的路上。

en: How about some coffee?
zh: 喝杯咖啡怎么样？

en: She lost a book.
zh: 她丢了一本书。

en: Will he recover?
zh: 他能康复吗？

en: He is a gentleman among gentlemen.
zh: 他是绅士中的绅士。

en: I have already finished reading this book.
zh: 这本书我已经看完了。

en: I've already finished reading this book.
zh: 我已经把这本书看完了。

en: A cat has two ears.
zh: 猫有两只耳朵。

en: There aren't any problems.
zh: 没什么问题。

en: We'll decide it like men, bring the dice!
zh: 咱们像个爷们儿一样决胜负，拿骰子来！

en: We'll need twenty dice to play this game.
zh: 玩这个游戏得要二十个骰子。

en: Don't get steamed up.
zh: 别发火。

en: Whether we win or lose, I won't have any hard feelings.
zh: 不管输赢，我都不会记恨。

en: Papa, let's have a face-to-face laugh battle!
zh: 爸爸，咱们来比赛谁先笑！

en: Daddy, let's see if you can out-stare me.
zh: 爸爸，咱俩比比瞪眼，看谁先眨眼。

en: Daddy, let's have a staring contest.
zh: 爸爸，我们来玩瞪眼比赛吧。

en: Daddy, let's make faces at each other and see who can keep from laughing the longest.
zh: 爸爸，咱们互相做鬼脸，看谁憋笑最久。

en: I stared at papers all day today and now I'm tired.
zh: 我盯着文件看了一整天，现在累坏了。

en: The patient got over the critical stage.
zh: 病人已经脱离了危险期。

en: My parents had an arranged marriage.
zh: 我父母是包办婚姻。

en: I'm hating this weather!
zh: 我真讨厌这天气！

en: He has a white cat.
zh: 他有一只白猫。

en: The meeting ended.
zh: 会议结束了。

en: In Japan, radioactive cesium was detected in baby formula.
zh: 日本的婴儿奶粉里检测出了放射性铯。

en: A leak has been found at Tokyo Electricity's Fukishima reactor number 1, and 150 liters of waters have escaped into the sea.
zh: 东京电力福岛第一核反应堆发现泄漏，有150升水流入了大海。

en: If you pass this test, you could graduate next month.
zh: 如果你通过了这次考试，下个月就能毕业。

en: Me and him are friends.
zh: 我和他是朋友。

en: I want you to kiss me.
zh: 我想让你亲亲我。

en: My three-year-old niece kissed me on the cheek.
zh: 我三岁的侄女亲了我的脸颊。

en: She's a precocious one eh?
zh: 这孩子挺早熟的，哈？

en: She was the first girl I'd ever kissed.
zh: 她是我亲过的第一个女孩。

en: What time do you think he'll come back?
zh: 你觉得他大概几点回来？

en: What time do you think he'll be back?
zh: 你觉得他什么时候能回来？

en: Is it raining?
zh: 下雨了吗？

en: Why do the five yen coin and the fifty yen coin have holes in the center?
zh: 为什么5日元和50日元的硬币中间有孔？

en: I have a sore throat. Do you have a cough drop?
zh: 我嗓子疼，你那儿有润喉糖吗？

en: The natural sweet-fish broiled with salt is absolutely terrific.
zh: 盐烤天然香鱼简直太棒了。

en: It is true that Aristotle distinguishes the tyrant from the king by the fact that the former governs in his own interest, and the latter only for the good of his subjects; but it would follow from Aristotle's distinction that, from the very beginning of the world, there has not yet been a single king.
zh: 亚里士多德确实根据统治者是为私利还是为臣民利益来区分暴君和君主，但按他的标准，自人类开端以来，恐怕还没出现过一位真正的君主。

en: The pleasure of possessing is not in my estimation worth the trouble of acquiring.
zh: 在我看来，拥有的快感不值得获取它时费的那些周折。

en: You left us, mate.
zh: 伙计，你把我们抛下了。

en: Why do you ignore me?
zh: 你为什么不理我？

en: Excuse me, I'd like a double scoop of mint chocolate chip and orange sherbet in a regular-size cone please.
zh: 你好，我要一个普通规格的甜筒，两个球，薄荷巧克力和香橙雪芭味。

en: Ready, rock-paper-scissors! It's a draw!
zh: 预备，石头剪刀布！平局！

en: She bought a new car.
zh: 她买了一辆新车。

en: Making a living as a manga artist is almost impossible.
zh: 靠画漫画谋生几乎是不可能的。

en: Have you read "Structure and Power - Beyond Semiotics" by Akira Asada?
zh: 你读过浅田彰的《结构与力：超越符号学》吗？

en: I lost my grandfather to cancer this year.
zh: 我爷爷今年因为癌症去世了。

en: My grandfather succumbed to a terminal cancer this year.
zh: 我爷爷今年死于癌症晚期。

en: Don't wait.
zh: 别等了。

en: Is that from a book?
zh: 那是书里的吗？

en: Jiro Akagawa has written over 480 novels.
zh: 赤川次郎写了480多部小说。

en: Face facts!
zh: 面对现实吧！

en: Oh no!
zh: 糟了！

en: Did you see yesterday's total lunar eclipse?
zh: 你看昨天的月全食了吗？

en: I got a new girlfriend; you didn't know?
zh: 我交了新女朋友，你不知道吗？

en: Her insistence was right. She did not need to feel ashamed.
zh: 她的坚持是对的，她没必要觉得羞愧。

en: As is often the case with educated people, he likes classical music better than popular music.
zh: 就像很多受过教育的人一样，他比起流行音乐更喜欢古典乐。

en: I was at home.
zh: 我当时在家。

en: I am a member of the basketball team.
zh: 我是篮球队的。

en: She has about 2,000 books.
zh: 她大约有两千本书。

en: Tom told me he wasn't afraid of Mary.
zh: 汤姆跟我说他不怕玛丽。

en: Mandarin is spoken by more people than any other language.
zh: 说普通话的人比说其他任何语言的人都多。

en: I'm in the other ambulance!
zh: 我在另一辆救护车里！

en: I want to watch television.
zh: 我想看电视。

en: I looked for you everywhere and didn't find you.
zh: 我到处找你都没找着。

en: Do you find me a cool guy?
zh: 你觉得我酷吗？

en: Do you think I'm cool?
zh: 你觉得我酷吗？

en: Do you think of me as a cool guy?
zh: 你觉得我是个酷哥吗？

en: Let's go to the field and fly kites, what do you say?
zh: 咱们去地里放风筝吧，你觉得怎么样？

en: Don't exaggerate now.
zh: 别夸张了。

en: You can add sentences that you can't translate yourself. Maybe someone else can translate them!
zh: 你可以把自己翻译不了的句子加进去，也许别人能翻译呢！

en: I have some time.
zh: 我有点时间。

en: I went to school by train.
zh: 我是坐火车去学校的。

en: I went to school at 8:30.
zh: 我是八点半去学校的。

en: You eat food.
zh: 你吃东西。

en: The cookies are under the table.
zh: 饼干在桌子下面。

en: A cookie is under the table.
zh: 有块饼干在桌子下面。

en: Did you live here?
zh: 你以前住这儿吗？

en: Did you live here before?
zh: 你以前住过这儿吗？

en: How many Chinese friends do you have?
zh: 你有几个中国朋友？

en: Is it far?
zh: 远吗？

en: It's supposed to snow tomorrow.
zh: 明天应该会下雪。

en: What does that mean. I don't understand.
zh: 那是什么意思？我不明白。

en: What do you mean. I don't get it.
zh: 你什么意思？我不懂。

en: Some Whites seek more imperial solutions.
zh: 一些白人寻求更帝国式的解决方案。

en: Some Asians seek more technological solutions.
zh: 一些亚洲人寻求更技术化的解决方案。

en: Some Middle-Easterners seek more religious solutions.
zh: 一些中东人寻求更宗教化的解决方案。

en: The beard's gone!
zh: 胡子没了！

en: After I got out of the bath, my wound festered.
zh: 洗完澡以后，我的伤口化脓了。

en: I drank a very hot double espresso at the coffee shop this morning.
zh: 今天早上我在咖啡店喝了一杯很烫的双倍浓缩咖啡。

en: There are some cookies under the table.
zh: 桌子下面有些饼干。

en: There is a cookie under the table.
zh: 桌子下面有一块饼干。

en: Doctors and hospitals should help everyone.
zh: 医生和医院应该帮助所有人。

en: I'm a citizen of the world.
zh: 我是世界公民。

en: I am a citizen of the world.
zh: 我是世界公民。

en: The boy threw a stone.
zh: 那个男孩扔了一块石头。

en: This time it's my turn to pay.
zh: 这次该我买单了。

en: What on earth are you looking at?
zh: 你到底在看什么？

en: John made Mary jump.
zh: 约翰把玛丽吓了一跳。

en: I got a sunburn.
zh: 我晒伤了。

en: I learn ten new words every day.
zh: 我每天学十个生词。

en: Tom didn't know the meaning of "anglophobia," so he did a quick web search to see if he could find out what it meant.
zh: 汤姆不知道“恐英症”是什么意思，所以他上网搜了一下。

en: God is in the detail.
zh: 细节之中有上帝。

en: Listen!
zh: 听着！

en: It has been six years since I started to study English.
zh: 我学英语已经六年了。

en: I was nine years old when I asked my mother whether Father Christmas really existed.
zh: 我九岁的时候问我妈圣诞老人是不是真的存在。

en: She can take control of the situation.
zh: 她能掌控局面。

en: I've become very sleepy.
zh: 我变得特别困。

en: I have a gift for you.
zh: 我有个礼物要送给你。

en: I have to find that.
zh: 我得把那个找出来。

en: Isn't it nice when the newcomers are still so innocent?
zh: 看到新人还这么单纯，不是挺好的吗？

en: I was really surprised to hear that this cultivator cost as much as 1 million yen.
zh: 听说这台耕耘机要100万日元，我真吃了一惊。

en: I forget, do they have a panda at the Ueno Zoo?
zh: 我忘了，上野动物园有熊猫吗？

en: Excuse me, do you mind if I sit here?
zh: 打扰一下，请问我能坐这儿吗？

en: I won't let you escape.
zh: 我不会让你逃跑的。

en: Tell me about this girl.
zh: 跟我说说这个女孩吧。

en: We're not as young as we used to be.
zh: 我们不像以前那么年轻了。

en: However, I am not a specialist.
zh: 不过，我不是专家。

en: We uploaded the pictures from our wedding on Facebook.
zh: 我们把婚礼照片传到Facebook上了。

en: I love Aimer's songs.
zh: 我超喜欢Aimer的歌。

en: I have to pay a little more attention.
zh: 我得再多留点心。

en: Please don't drink beer before going to bed.
zh: 睡觉前请别喝啤酒。

en: She's my wife.
zh: 她是我老婆。

en: She has a mysterious air about her.
zh: 她身上有一种神秘感。

en: It was a wrong number.
zh: 打错电话了。

en: He is diligent.
zh: 他很勤奋。

en: I can't reply to you immediately.
zh: 我没法马上回你。

en: Please, help my daughter.
zh: 请救救我女儿。

en: Have you come to file a damage report?
zh: 你是来报损的吗？

en: Have you come to register a crime?
zh: 你是来报案的吗？

en: I'm not a handyman.
zh: 我不是修理工。

en: Don't go there.
zh: 别去那儿。

en: What relieves the pain?
zh: 什么东西能止痛？

en: It's the funniest dog in the world.
zh: 它是世界上最有趣的狗。

en: Are you trying to hit on me?
zh: 你是在撩我吗？

en: You have to push that door to open it.
zh: 你得推那扇门才能打开。

en: If you push it, the door will open.
zh: 推一下，门就开了。

en: If you push the button, the door will open.
zh: 按一下按钮，门就开了。

en: She was injured in a car accident.
zh: 她在车祸中受伤了。

en: She has nice legs.
zh: 她的腿很漂亮。

en: This is the first time I've heard about it.
zh: 这事我还是头一回听说。

en: It's the first time I've heard that.
zh: 这是我第一次听说。

en: Her cooking is the best.
zh: 她做的饭最好吃。
